BlueSotel Krabi
8.3 Excellent
Based on 1205 reviews

Pros: Relatively new hotel with small defects. Nice swimming pool. Large room. 2 water bottles provided.

Cons: Upon arrival staff looked tired and repeated same sentences. No smile, no thanks. It was far from being nice and polite. We were asked for credit card or 2000bath deposit for room. We had twin room but when we checked it it was double. Went down to reception and they turned me down that i am wrong (like stupid). I had to force them to send someone!!! Of course when they found out they changed it within 20 minutes. Breakfast buffet for 300 bath has eggs, sausages, chicken rice, stew with fish and potatoes, bread corner, fruit corner. Expected more variety for 4 star hotel and this price. For half price you can get much better value.

Show more
Marek , Slovakia
The Pelican Residence & Suites Krabi
8.1 Excellent
Based on 154 reviews

This has been a dream holiday which families with young children can often only dream of! We had a top floor, sea view room with our own pool.

Every morning we would slide open the patio doors, feel the warm, balmy air hit our faces and slip into the idyllic infinity pool overlooking the crystal clear waters of the beach below. The hotel is new, only a year old and as such the facilities are sparkling and there very few guests as yet. Our room had 2 bedrooms, plus a kitchen and living area and was beautiful. The balcony had our own pool, day bed and sun loungers which we often used late in the day for drinks on the balcony to watch the sun set. The breakfast buffet was fantastic-delicious, authentic curries and western food for those who want it (we didn't!) The delicate spices of a thai green curry awaken your senses and are far more satisfying than a bowl of carb-loaded cereals. The omelette chef was fantastic! Our children loved the pizzas, delivered to us by the main hotel pool. We spent out evenings on the beach opposite the hotel which has a row of local restaurants and beach bars, all offering cheap cocktails, ice-cold local beers, delicious local cuisine and of course an endless play area: the golden sands. Our children were in heaven and we were in paradise! As part of our trip we hired a long tail boat which took us around 4 islands, where we did snorkelling to find Nemo! We found him. Idyllic! We also went elephant trekking, which the hotel kindly booked for us. We were collected by the trekking centre and we rode elephants for an hour through the forests and got to feed them bananas. The company is called Nosey Parkers-I would highly recommend them! Finally, we loved the hotel beach bar, called The Nest-a gorgeous bar which serves delicious food. It is not as busy as it should be perhaps as it is so new-it deserves to be full! It's beautiful! Thank you to all the staff, especially Pauline the GM for making our stay so magical and memorable! We will be

Show more
Jennifer , United Kingdom
Centra by Centara Phu Pano Resort Krabi
8.5 Excellent
Based on 347 reviews

First time i write down review about resort. This resort was awesome to us. First place looks nice and clean.

And when we reach at resort, staff also so friendly and kind. They have wide knowledge about resort and krabi recommend place all. It was very helpful. Room service and restaruant food quality also worthy. (Our room not include breakfast, so that wan i dont know) Travel agency also very kind N helpful, so it was very smooth. From hotel to aonang beach by walk 15-20min,by tuktuk 10minute. We are just walking from resort to beach. On the way there were many shop for shopping. We were very satisfied and really recommend this resort and krabi trip. Thanks to phu pano, our trip was perfect. Thank you !!

Show more
Lee , South Korea
Aonang Viva Resort
7.9 Very good
Based on 879 reviews

hotel working staff open our room at 1am even we locked. My husband shouted and he run away. Then we call to receiption and he is the one who open our door.

We don't know what he want and he said he open to a wrong room. We are scare and wake up to request to see the manager. But we only manage to call the manager and the manager claim that all the staff can holding all the room master key. He say sorry to us saying that the staff accidently open to the wrong room as he is new. Imagine a hotel giving a staff which is working less than 2 mths holding all the master keys. We feel unsecure. We don't know is really he is careless and what he want. Then he is the only person work at night shift which we think it is not enough man power if anything happen. The breakfast also not nice and boring. Majority of the staffs also cannot speak in english and not helpful at all. The only good things is the bed is huge. Really feel disappointing.

Show more
chia , Malaysia
Maneetel Krabi Beachfront
8.3 Excellent
Based on 51 reviews

The Phu Beach Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 397 reviews

The environment of the hotel is as shown in picture, very nice, spacious and clean. However the way they handled the customers was not good.

When we first arrived at the hotel, we were given a free upgrade to the family suite (which we dont really need as there was only the 2 of us). However when we got back at night, we received a slip of paper telling us that the upgrade was only for 1 day and we need to move out the next day. We were shocked as we had already unpacked everything and our tour the next day was early in the morning. We confronted them for the reason for the shift, however it was really difficult to convey our feeling as their english is quite limited. We were told that our room had been fully booked. But how can this happened ? We booked our hotel during november last year (5 months in advance)! The hotel gave me a feeling that they prioritized revenue over customers, slotting us into any available room and asked us to move when the room is taken. We were unhappy for 3 reasons 1) they never inform us in advance that the upgrade is only for a night 2) why our original room was full despite us booking 5 months in advance? 3) we had no choice but to leave our luggage with the reception as the next room was not available in the morning (we were forced to check out after a night). We were also promised that our luggage will be kept safely, however we noticed our luggages were left UNATTENDED at the corridor, accessible to the public. Will I recommend others to stay? NO. Maybe a yes if u think u are lucky and this kind of double booking situation wont happen to u.

Show more
WAI , Singapore
Krabi SeaBass Hotel
8.9 Excellent
Based on 128 reviews

Best Hotel so far on our 6 week holiday. Great reception staff. Breakfast is a very strange affair.

You will be asked the day before to choose your breakfast from a menu - you will receive it in the morning with only one piece of toast - ice cold - as it would appear to have been prepared very early that morning. Only once during our stay of 4 nights did the have a buffet breakfast as they had quite a few guest to cater for. Rooms are large but has no cupboards. Irritating issue is everything extra is charged for ie: toast at breakfast - 10 Bht. for a printed copy of our Ferry tickets and a quote of 300 Bht. for a transfer to the pier. (Free when you book your ferry ticket with Phuket ferry.) We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Show more
Jan , South Africa
Sugar Marina Resort-CLIFFHANGER-Aonang
8.2 Excellent
Based on 98 reviews

Enjoyed the place and the room - great queen beds, pleasant colors of white and wood, liked the shower.

A room with a pool view was a pleasure, though some construction was being held right behind the pool (but it didn't spoil the overall impression, no disturbing noise or whatever, hope that they are doing something beautiful there). The check in was fast and with no deposit. Had some problems with opening the balcony door but the staff solved it immediately, good job. The restaurant is really really pleasant place, liked the food and furniture. The only thing which needs serious consideration is the overall cleanliness of the place - construction dust on the walls and on the floor... the mirrors and the window glass are not cleaned properly, the curtains are not ironed, no ashtrays though smoking is allowed on the balconies etc. As if they were in a hurry to open and let the guests in. I hope that the hotel staff and administration will pay more attention because these details create the atmosphere of the place. No closet or shelves or other places to put your clothes may be a little problem if you travel with company... Still, I enjoyed my stay and would stay in Sugar Marina again.

Show more
Maria , Russia
iRest Ao Nang Sea Front
8.4 Excellent
Based on 61 reviews

Pros: Sea front, like really seafront Quite place Near McDonald, Watson and Family mart, very convenient Clean bed, bathroom, toilet Friendly and helpful staffs Cons: No place to dry wet clothes No curturn for big window in dorm(if you got the bed near window , people will look at how you sleeps whenever they pass by, and no changing in room )😱 Floors a bit sticky due to sea breeze, but quite clean, much appreciate if allow to wear slippers to walk in room

Ai , Malaysia
Pavilion Queens Bay Hotel
7.3 Very good
Based on 1257 reviews

The room facilities where hopeless! And the staff of the hotel does not give a solution. Beside the furniture is very, very, very old, and he cleanliness is not the best in the world, we had the pleasure of hot water in the shower and bad.

Yes HOT, only HOT. Cold water to mix was not available or didn’t work. No panic just call the staff to ask if they can explain how to get cold water or if we didn’t did anything wrong if they could repair the water supply. Within 5 minutes someone came to the room and within 20 seconds he could inform us that he could not repair this, most probably he had been to this room many times before to conclude that he cannot repair this. Again no problem, just go to the reception and ask for a different room……………….., Not possible all rooms are occupied!!!!! (or all rooms having the same problem???) No doubt the hotel was NOT fully booked and asking Agoda via internet if there were still rooms available the answer given as usual was ONLY 5 rooms available, meaning plenty rooms available. Nevertheless we could not get a different room but we always could use the showers of the swimming pool. Also we thought lets go for the weekend to Krabi and just book a “reasonable cheap” hotel as we only will be in the room for the night…………………….. ! Pay a bit more and have the possibility to take a shower before diner etc etc.

Show more
Menno , Netherlands
Krabi Heritage Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 1539 reviews

I visited Krabi for the 1st time and unknowingly I booked this hotel. Trust me, this is like a hidden treasure in Aonang! The hotel is located at 2min walking distance from Aonang beach and its just on the main road.

Lots of restaurants, travel information centre, dive center massage parlours, bike rentals, gift shops are located nearby. The reception & the housekeeping staffs of the hotel are friendly. There is a big breakfast area in the ground floor and one can enjoy american buffet breakfast at 200 thb (if not included in the room charge). The buffet has variety of spread and it remains almost same everyday (that is what I understood from my 3day stay) At another corner of the ground floor there is a tourist information counter too. There is an outdoor pool with plenty of sun loungers around. The hotel provides towels at pool. The rooms are quite big and spacious. We enjoyed the scenic view of the mountains lying in our bed through the glass door of the attached small balcony. The room was really nice and well presented. If you are a music lover, then you can enjoy music from distance sitting at your room only! The bathroom is clean. It has bath tub and separate shower area. The hotel has the facility for providing connecting rooms. So if you are traveling in groups, you can opt for this. Only minor issue is that the wifi does not work well in the room. Overall its really worth staying in this hotel. If I again visit Krabi, I am going to stay in this hotel and definitely recommend others!!

Show more
Sayani , India
8 ICON BY I GALLERIA KRABI
8.6 Excellent
Based on 198 reviews

Value : price is reasonable. The room is spacious and clean. Bed & pillows were cozy! The staffs brought us into our rooms and explain on how to use some of the items and what are the charges, which was very thoughtful and clear to avoid any confusion/arguments.

They made the room every day throughout my stay. Clean towels and even refilled the toiletries! Lemongrass flavor, loving the smell; soothing! Wish it could be purchased! Complimentary only two small water bottles (refilled everyday), not sure if we could ask for more. But buying additional 1.5L from the convenience stall doesn't cost much either. Not sure if I was in old or new wing but there was no elevator in my wing. But the staff carried our bags up to the 3rd floor (highest) upon arrival. We dragged them down on the last day. There's hair dryer (important for girls with long hair), kettle for hot water, no iron but not needed. They provide a beach bag and a mat too, which was of good use, so thoughtful! Beach view would be great but this is not a beach front hotel, so view wasn't a priority. They had a bad garbage dumping system (someone reviewed about it too) before entering the premise, so the smell is there day/night. I had the last room on the 3rd floor, so part of my view was the garbage. Thankfully no smell. Just one night, we heard someone ransacking the bins for glass bottles. Had them to arrange for airport transfer and it was smooth. Was welcomed with drinks and they managed to let us check in an hour earlier as we arrived 6 hours before the check in time 2pm. Our check out was at 6am cause of our early flight, and it was smooth too. Facilities : booked because of the swimming pool but didn't get to use it even. Too many activities, had no time for that, and pool closes at 8pm. Don't think the bar is opened yet. Breakfast was average, not bad. The choices were tasty. Location : very convenient! Everything is so nearby (7-Eleven/Family Mart/restaurants/tourist information kiosk/massage c

Show more
Onn , Malaysia
Kokotel Krabi Ao Nang
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 14 reviews

Mini House Aonang
9 Excellent
Based on 1315 reviews

The Manager was really helpful, friendly and accommodating. The staff members though were a little inflexible.

For example, when we said that we had a tour at 745am, and asked if breakfast could be pre-ordered and served earlier, we were told the earliest it could be done was 7:20am. In the end, breakfast sets only arrived at 7:40am, and we could only go on the tour at 8:00am. The room also appeared poorly cleaned in the afternoon we checked in, and for some reason, bugs kept coming into the room we had. The sound proofing was very poor, and we could hear the doors being shut by the next room, when they talked too loudly, and when the unit above us moved their chairs. On our last night, power in the whole of Aonang went out for about 2 hours, but the staff members did not seem to know what to do, nor did they take the initiative to update the guests on what was happening. My friend was in the showers, and apparently the hotel works on an electric pump - no more water was available once the power went out. Overall, it's a nice place, but needs a lot more improvement to make the stay comfortable.

Show more
Adrian , Singapore
Marina Express - Fisherman Hotel - Ao Nang
8.4 Excellent
Based on 672 reviews

The hotel is a neat and clean property. We arrived an hour or two early and were made to wait until the check-in time which is not a big gripe until you read the rest of what follows.

We were a group of 5 and needed an extra bed, which btw is expensive 1000THB per night and to our shock it wasn't a bed rather a couch available in all the standard rooms. So why pay 1000THB ?? We raised our concern with the front desk very politely indeed and were told that was the best of their arrangement. Dissatisfied, when we insisted on a refund, the staff very rudely insisted on moving the extra person out of the room IMMEDIATELY so to quote - "Ask your friend to pack his bags and leave. We need to see him leave NOW and we will refund!". Quoting to the word and no exaggeration here. I'm sensible enough to understand it's the hotel policy to refund after the extra person moves out, but this is obviously not the way to retort to a polite inquiry. That was an awful experience bcz we had amazing time at 4 other hotels we stayed at in our 1-week Thai trip. This hotel is off my list for all future travels.

Show more
Ab , India
Wakeup Aonang Hotel
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 37 reviews

Great service. Staff was warm and helpful. Babycot was provided without the need to request. The location is perfect.

Alot of halal restaurants around. Near to pharmacy and 7eleven. The only fall back is that there is a high and steep stair case to walk up to the hotel reception/lift to the room which makes it inconvenient for people with young children and strollers like me. not ideal for older or wheelchair bounded guests. and I find the corridor to the room a little dark and creepy at night. Apart from that, everything else is great especially the staffs. Very pleasant stay.

Show more
Siti , Singapore
Beach Terrace Hotel
7.2 Very good
Based on 597 reviews

The location is great near to all the restaurants, shopping, the beach, the massage parlors. Bad thing is, I got the room with the roof view, very bad view, I asked for high floor and sea view and double bed when I booked in agoda, but I was surprised when I didn't get what I requested, nevertheless the front desk staff never smile at all, looks very proud.

Secondly I booked for the hot spring tour the next day, the guy at the counter that night told me that the transport will pick me up at 7:30am, I was so disappionted when the staff at the front desk same lady when I arrived the hotel, told me that it's so early to call the tour people as it's only 7am, when she manage to call the tour people, she told me that the the hot spring tour is closed for that day because of the festival that the thai people celebrate, so I asked for an option what tour is available, I asked for the 4island tour, I thought Phi Phi island is included in the 4 island tour...suddenly she call call the tour travel again and i saw her writing on a receipt, and told me okey 1,200 baht, I was surprised cos the day after another lady told me that 4island tour was 800baht...I was so angry with her cos she didn't gave me options, nor even asked me where am I comfortable with, she's got a very bad attitude, very rude when talking to her customer. So I asked her to call her manager. Luckily the manager was really nice, I told her that her staff was very rude etc etc...and she was sorry for that. I got the 4 island tour with the manager's help, thanks to her, a big plus to the manager. One more thing I noticed is, the 2nd day, they forgot to refill the coffee, so I still have to asked for the refill. Breakfast was very limited and not so good, tables are not cleaned, the only plus is the sea view from their restaurant, thanks to that.

Show more
Maria , Philippines
ibis Styles Krabi Ao Nang
8.1 Excellent
Based on 944 reviews

Hotel was very new, and staff were great. Pool was very nice. Bed was very comfy. overall decor was very warm and inviting.

View from hotel room was facing mountain very nice to just relax and sip on a coffee on a rainy day. Wifi was like super strong. i could stream netflix while downloading stuff no problem.Power-points are the kind that accept any countries plugs so you don't to bring your own adapters. 4 points in total. Rooms are quite small, toilets did not have bathtub. Morning breakfast buffet is average at best (i would give the hotel 5 stars if not for the lousy breakfast). much better to take the free bus to beach and get food. Location was the biggest issue, It was a hassle to go to and fro from the beach. They have shuttle bus every hour but if you miss it then you need to walk 25min or take a tuk tuk. There is a 7 eleven like 10 mins away and some restaurants nearby, but they lack the character and quality of food one would expect from a beach front area.

Show more
Abdul , India
Ancora Blu Boutique Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 459 reviews

Reservation was made the night before departure, I guess is due to off peak season. Airport transfer via local bus was only 150bht for 1 person, reaching the doorstep of Ancora, about 30mins.

I was carrying a small haversack so stairs climbing wasn't an issue. Room was clean, neat, new, spacious with mountain view. Balcony for tea or readings. I took the free tuk tuk from hotel to eatery and shopping street (1-way free transport only, journey 5mins). Whereby return I took a tuk tuk that cost me 60bht. The next day I decided to walk back which took me 30mins, along the way there's shops and local food. The only negative experience is the unexpected power trip during the first night, total darkness, luckily I was already resting on the bed though is only ~8pm. I called the recept and she told me it takes 1 hr to fix the issue but WIFI is still working. What the h***! I need power more than internet connection! (I quickly activate my 'flashlight' mobile apps). I requested for candles or torchlight immediately, which they manage to supply fast. Eventually the power came back after ~15mins but it was a long wait. Staff was telling me is the first time having power trip but I doubt so as power got cut off again the next morning! (Bring along a torch even if you're staying in high class hotel, never unestimate). Breakfast was by order; choices of eggs, sandwiches, porridge. Omelette and porridge was pretty saltish to me as I prefer light stuff. Overall, recommend only if you wana stay in nicely design, clean room.

Show more
Huang , Singapore
Aonang Cliff Beach Suites and Villas
8.6 Excellent
Based on 109 reviews

Jennifer , United States
Rayavadee Hotel
9.3 Exceptional
Based on 500 reviews

We had an enjoyable stay at the Rayavadee, but are surprised by the Agoda rating of 9.2. Ratings over 9 are rare and are usually reversed for the worlds very best hotels - that are world class in terms of their location/setting, their rooms, the service, and the crusine.

Rayavadee is not a world class hotel in all of these areas. I would rate the Rayavadee as an Agoda 8.3 to 8.4 rating. The location, room (or rather villa) were certainly spectacular. But the crusine and service standards are far from world class. On the downside are their charges. The most extreme example is the airport transfer. A (private) taxi can be easily booked on arrival at Krabi airport to the pier where the Ravayadee boat departs for THB350. The Rayavadee charge for the same service is THB3,800++. I know 5 star hotels charge high prices, but over 10 times the price for exactly the same service is beyond reasonable and is quite outrageous and I question the integrity of management attempting to charge "unsuspecting tourists" this amount. Management justify the charge by claiming it is "a private car transfer", seemingly overlooking the fact that the taxi charge of THB350 is also a "private transfer" - and not a shared vehicle. My tips. 1. Don't use their airport transfer services and pay the outrageous charges. The costs are totally unnecessary and taxi's are readily available and provide exactly the same service for less than one tenth of the cost. 2. Don't book the excursions offered at the hotel. They are similarly expensive and are best booked directly with operators at Ao Nang. And anyway, while at the Rayavadee and paying the top dollar cost of the accommodation, best to make use the Rayavadee facilities and leave an excursion for another day. In summary, a great place to stay, and an enjoyable experience, although over-rated by Agoda at 9.2, and the lack of integrity applying such outrageous charges, even by 5 star hotel standards, is disappointing.

Food: Breakfast buffet lived up to the hype- it really had a lot of food and was different every morning. Room service is also great, just make sure you let them know you're putting it outside so bugs don't get to it! Housekeeping was also great- I'm prone to mosquitoes and while I did find a couple in the room (you ARE in the jungle afterall!), our housekeeper left us a bottle of spray after she sprayed the room down just in case! We were also lucky enough to stay for the New Year Eve gala, and it was fantastic. You can tell the staff really spent a lot of time and energy putting this all together, with a show and an amazing food spread- unfortunately we were so tired when 11pm rolled around that we weren't able to count down with everyone, but it really is such a treat. Overall I found every staff member to be extremely helpful, and you can see they are working long hours. But it takes about 40 Mins drive in mini van(200 THB per person) or taxi (500 THB for 3 pax). The resort staff is very humble and courteous. They are always smiling and ready to help you in any which way possible. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The house keeping staff cleans the room every day. There is some construction happening within the property, but that does not disturb. The breakfast has a huge variety and has amazing beach view. Resort has two swimming pools and both are amazing and clean. One of the swimming pool has a pool bar attached as well. Just outside the resort there is delicious hygienic halal street food, that is sold from Friday. The pricing is also very reasonable. Within a Kilometer there are so many shops, bars, massage parlors, Currency exchange shops, Travel booking, day trip booking and air port transfer shops. The resort is perfectly located as it close to many shops and has a lot of options for food and shopping. All in all, it is an excellent place to stay and would love to come back here again

anne , United States
Railay Great View Resort
8 Very good
Based on 1605 reviews

The little bungalows, perched on a hill overlooking Railay East, are lovely. Romantic (ha, I was alone) mosquito netting draped over the bed, a writing table, tv with cable, A/C, and huge, luxurious bathroom.

Breakfast was lovely - fresh fruit, muesli, yogurt, a little omelet bar. The coffee wasn't good, and the "milk" was powdered. The pool was lovely - clean, great view overlooking the water. My two complaints were pretty minor. #1 - it's at the far end of East Railay, a little isolated. This was also great, as it meant it was quiet. The other thing was that you had to wait for the cleaners to check your room before you left. In the age of booking on-line, where there's little chance they can track you down, and people break/steal things, I guess it's understandable, but it was a little bit awkward. My criticisms are with east Railay and Krabi as a whole. There is no "beach" at east Railay. It's a pretty gross, swampy, smelly mangrove, particularly at low-tide. The nicer beach is on West Railay, where the hotels and restaurants are a lot more expensive. The REALLY nice beach, Phra Nang, is beautiful, but overrun by day-trippers. I tried to lie on the beach but it was like trying to sunbathe on a super-highway. I will never go back to Krabi again, and I would caution people against it. I get that tourists are annoying, but there's a weird vibe from almost all of the service people - a hostility, unfriendliness, unwillingness to help unless you're paying them (too much money) to do something. At every turn - people were nasty, sour, rude. I'm pretty easy going and was pretty fed up with it by the end. So, between the grottiness of East Railay, the rudeness of the people and the inflated prices for everything, I would recommend people not go to Krabi. That said, if you do (it is a lot easier to get there than to any of the islands as it's a direct flight), pay the extra money to stay on Railay, not in Krabi or Ao Nang. Those are horrible places.

My husband and I initially stayed 2 nights at Railay West but was not very satisfied with the hotel. The beach was great but price was expensive for its facilities so we decided to move to the East side where Avatar Railay is located.

Pros: - Reception is easy to find and very friendly. We arrived around 12pm and were given welcome drinks and told our rooms weren't ready yet — that we'd have to wait until 2pm to check-in but they were happy to hold our luggage for us. They offered us to hang out by the pool while we waited. 30 minutes later the staff picked us up from the pool with our backpacks on his back and was happy to take us to our room. - The room was very clean, new and modern. Everything was to our liking and worked well. Wi-Fi, TV, AC, plumbing, doors, etc all worked well. - They had a nice balcony, with a pool view + lounging area that had a nifty drying rack. - It was nice that the toilet, sink and shower were all separated especially if you have more than 2 people sharing the room. - The pool was clean and new. Had a few floaties for you to enjoy. - Guests were mainly couples or families, so it's fairly quiet. Although a few groups of people can get occasionally rowdy (not drunk rowdy but more happy rowdy) - Breakfast variety was good and quite delicious. - Staff were always friendly and would greet you whenever they saw you. Cons: - Dining at the restaurant (other than the free breakfast) was relatively expensive. We ate out because of this. - Some mischievous monkeys would come swing by to disturb the cleaning crew and their kits so try not to leave food / trash outside your door and balcony. A big group of us checked in for 3 nights 28/3 - 31/3, and they were kind enough to provide free air port pick up (min 3 nites stay), and only charged us 600baht(9 pax - big van) for the trip back to the airport on the last day! The room itself was reasonably spacious, clean and overall a pleasant place to have a good night's rest. The toilet smelled a bit of unaired mildew but they provided spray air fresheners so we had no issues on that. The beach, street food, 7-11, and massages were all within 10 mins walk from the hotel. Breakfast was acceptable, and they were nice enough to pack sandwiches for us to bring to the airport on the last day as we couldn't make it in time to finish our breakfast at the hotel. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay at Golden Moon B&B and hope that they will keep up the good service!

We were here for 7 days and knew Ao Nang was touristy and overpriced so we were happy when we found a deal for a discounted stay here.

The location is nice, it is in the middle of Ao Nang Beach and Noparrathara Beach and you can quickly walk to either. There is also a row of street food carts just down the road which have delicious food that is MUCH cheaper than the restuarants in Ao Nang. They also replenished towels, toilet paper and water daily which was good. The room was large but there were a few issues.. -The bed, while a king size, was ridiculoulsy hard. Not like other places in Thailand, but like metal springs digging into your back and causing you to wake up in pain. We asked to change rooms but reception said all rooms had the same mattress. We did appreciate that they put a comforter as a mattress pad but it did little to help. It was honestly the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in. -Our room could use some repair..there were wierd stains on the wall and lots of cracks and holes. -The great TV they advertise does indeed have 200+ channels, but all in Thai. -We were located at one of the end buildings and right next door they were doing construction. Luckily it didn't start super early in the morning and was quiet at night but it could be loud during the day and there were a lot of large trucks driving through the normally tranquil grounds. I understand construction is necessary but perhaps if you stay there ask to be in a room closer to the front and away from the noise if that bothers you. -If we would turn the AC down under 26 degrees C then it would start to leak water all over the dresser/stuff underneath. All in all, my biggest complaint was the beds. However, if strapped for a place to stay I would consider staying here again as it was mostly quiet, afforable, and overall ok. I think if they could patch and paint the walls and invest in some better mattresses then it would be a very nice place indeed.

I have just stayed at Zabava Guest House and contrary to other people I did not have a problem finding it at all.

Funny enough even taxi drivers argue with you that there is no such place called Zabava and i believe it has been called 'Aloha' before. It is located in a small lane behind the main strip/beach road, the best marker to look for is Bollywood Indian restaurant, then turn into the little lane. Very convenient location in walking distance to all shops, restaurants, beach and long tail boat departure points. I stayed in the Deluxe blue room, the only room that has got a balcony and what clever marketing probably would sell as ocean glimpses ;). The room is tastefully furnished and absolutely huge (other places would sell this as a suite) with all the amenities you would not necessary expect from am guest house such as air con, fridge, kettle, safe, tv, free bottled water, coffee, tea and little bisquits every day. There is enough storage in a kind of dressing area in front of the bathroom and the room comes with a king size bed, little writing desk and extra sofa. Another plus are the plentiful power points to charge your devices such as mobile phones, computers etc. The free wifi works excellent day and night. The room gets cleaned every day and you also get fresh towels dailynot necessary something to take for granted even in better rated hotels. The owner Gyp can be found at reception between 9 am and 6 pm and she is a very friendly lady although with limited english but she is making every effort to help you. During low season you can negotiate a price of 700 Baht per night if you stay for a few days.Breakfast is not included in the price but there are plenty of options nearby. In short this is an excellent choice for someone who travels on a budget, wants to be close to everything and does not need amenities such as a pool. Room Tip: Choose the blue room, the only one with balcony. A bit more expensive but absolutely worth it.

Tina , Germany

8 Very good
Based on 781 reviews

We enjoyed our stay at the guesthouse. Ms. Yaa was very sweet and kind. She was not pushy about selling tours but rather informative and helpful.

The room was as basic as you could get: two towels, two pillows, a TV, no soap but at least it had an air conditioner that worked well. The wi-fi signal in room is really weak but is decent near the lobby. Most other guests would hang out in the blistering heat to be closer to the lobby and get better reception. I found the lack of internet connectivity in-room liberating actually. Her breakfast was decent and very affordable. We booked three tours through here. The quality of each tour was quite different as the Phi Phi was excellent but James Bond was only marginal. I really do think she picks the best tour companies though. If book a tour through her and you don't like it, there might not exist much better unless you book an expensive private tour. Pros: Clean, good location, great and affordable restaurants nearby, the lady helps with arranging anything you want for at least 100 baht cheaper than most other hotels. We only paid about 600 baht per night (great deal for Aircon in a safe, clean room) Cons: mosquitoes in the dining/lobby area, some of her workers waiting can seem a little unfriendly, poor wi-fi signal, very basic room amenities, only one outlet in the room. Overall, this a budget hotel so don't expect luxury. But, it is clean and the rooms are nice. Ms. Yaa can get you the best tours available at arguably the best prices around. You might find a better deal on tours elsewhere but you would waste a lot of time and spend that time uncomfortably haggling everyone.

More about Krabi

Located in the south of Thailand, Krabi is famed for its limestone formations, calm crystal seas, and beautiful beaches. Krabi Town is one of the most visited towns in the province, since it serves as a departure point for ferries to the islands in Phangna Bay such as Phi Phi and Koh Lanta. There are several notable beaches on the mainland close to Krabi Town including Ao Nang, Railay Beach and Had Yao.

Krabi International Airport serves travelers from Bangkok, Kuala Lumpur, Darwin, and Singapore and is just 15 kilometers from Krabi Town.

The main activities in Krabi Town and its outlying villages center on relaxing on the beach, making it a perfect destination for vacationers. Ao Nang is one of the more popular tourist areas in the region, and the main road through town is lined with hotels, restaurants, bars, and shops.

Klong Muang and Tub Kaek beaches are bit further north of Ao Nang and tend to cater to a more up-market crowd. The resorts on Klong Muang and Tub Kaek beaches offer a relaxed atmosphere and truly breathtaking views as well as top-notch services and facilities.

We were asked for credit card or 2000bath deposit for room. We had twin room but when we checked it it was double. Went down to reception and they turned me down that i am wrong (like stupid). I had to force them to send someone!!! Of course when they found out they changed it within 20 minutes. Show more Marek , Slovakia The Pelican Residence & Suites Krabi 8.1 Excellent Based on 154 reviews This has been a dream holiday which families with young children can often only dream of! We had a top floor, sea view room with our own pool. Every morning we would slide open the patio doors, feel the warm, balmy air hit our faces and slip into the idyllic infinity pool overlooking the crystal clear waters of the beach below. The hotel is new, only a year old and as such the facilities are sparkling and there very few guests as yet. Our room had 2 bedrooms, plus a kitchen and living area and was beautiful. The balcony had our own pool, day bed and sun loungers which we often used late in the day for drinks on the balcony to watch the sun set. The breakfast buffet was fantastic-delicious, authentic curries and western food for those who want it (we didn't!) The delicate spices of a thai green curry awaken your senses and are far more satisfying than a bowl of carb-loaded cereals. The omelette chef was fantastic! Our children loved the pizzas, delivered to us by the main hotel pool. We spent out evenings on the beach opposite the hotel which has a row of local restaurants and beach bars, all offering cheap cocktails, ice-cold local beers, delicious local cuisine and of course an endless play area: the golden sands. Our children were in heaven and we were in paradise! As part of our trip we hired a long tail boat which took us around 4 islands, where we did snorkelling to find Nemo! We found him. Idyllic! We also went elephant trekking, which the hotel kindly booked for us. We were collected by the trekking centre and we rode elephants for an hour through the forests and got to feed them bananas. The company is called Nosey Parkers-I would highly recommend them! Finally, we loved the hotel beach bar, called The Nest-a gorgeous bar which serves delicious food. It is not as busy as it should be perhaps as it is so new-it deserves to be full! It's beautiful! Thank you to all the staff, especially Pauline the GM for making our stay so magical and memorable! However the way they handled the customers was not good. However when we got back at night, we received a slip of paper telling us that the upgrade was only for 1 day and we need to move out the next day. We were shocked as we had already unpacked everything and our tour the next day was early in the morning. The hotel gave me a feeling that they prioritized revenue over customers, slotting us into any available room and asked us to move when the room is taken. We were unhappy for 3 reasons 1) they never inform us in advance that the upgrade is only for a night 2) why our original room was full despite us booking 5 months in advance? 3) we had no choice but to leave our luggage with the reception as the next room was not available in the morning (we were forced to check out after a night). We were also promised that our luggage will be kept safely, however we noticed our luggages were left UNATTENDED at the corridor, accessible to the public. Will I recommend others to stay? NO. My criticisms are with east Railay and Krabi as a whole. There is no "beach" at east Railay. It's a pretty gross, swampy, smelly mangrove, particularly at low-tide. The nicer beach is on West Railay, where the hotels and restaurants are a lot more expensive. The REALLY nice beach, Phra Nang, is beautiful, but overrun by day-trippers. I tried to lie on the beach but it was like trying to sunbathe on a super-highway. I will never go back to Krabi again, and I would caution people against it. I get that tourists are annoying, but there's a weird vibe from almost all of the service people - a hostility, unfriendliness, unwillingness to help unless you're paying them (too much money) to do something. At every turn - people were nasty, sour, rude. I'm pretty easy going and was pretty fed up with it by the end. So, between the grottiness of East Railay, the rudeness of the people and the inflated prices for everything, I would recommend people not go to Krabi. Very convenient location in walking distance to all shops, restaurants, beach and long tail boat departure points. I stayed in the Deluxe blue room, the only room that has got a balcony and what clever marketing probably would sell as ocean glimpses ;). The room is tastefully furnished and absolutely huge (other places would sell this as a suite) with all the amenities you would not necessary expect from am guest house such as air con, fridge, kettle, safe, tv, free bottled water, coffee, tea and little bisquits every day. There is enough storage in a kind of dressing area in front of the bathroom and the room comes with a king size bed, little writing desk and extra sofa. Another plus are the plentiful power points to charge your devices such as mobile phones, computers etc. The free wifi works excellent day and night. The room gets cleaned every day and you also get fresh towels dailynot necessary something to take for granted even in better rated hotels. The owner Gyp can be found at reception between 9 am and 6 pm and she is a very friendly lady although with limited english but she is making every effort to help you. During low season you can negotiate a price of 700 Baht per night if you stay for a few days.Breakfast is not included in the price but there are plenty of options nearby. In short this is an excellent choice for someone who travels on a budget, wants to be close to everything and does not need amenities such as a pool. Room Tip: Choose the blue room, the only one with balcony. A bit more expensive but absolutely worth it. Show more Tina , Germany BanTo Guesthouse 8 Very good Based on 781 reviews We enjoyed our stay at the guesthouse. Ms. Yaa was very sweet and kind. She was not pushy about selling tours but rather informative and helpful. The room was as basic as you could get: two towels, two pillows, a TV, no soap but at least it had an air conditioner that worked well. The wi-fi signal in room is really weak but is decent near the lobby. Most other guests would hang out in the blistering heat to be closer to the lobby and get better reception. I found the lack of internet connectivity in-room liberating actually. Her breakfast was decent and very affordable. We booked three tours through here. The quality of each tour was quite different as the Phi Phi was excellent but James Bond was only marginal. I really do think she picks the best tour companies though. If book a tour through her and you don't like it, there might not exist much better unless you book an expensive private tour. Pros: Clean, good location, great and affordable restaurants nearby, the lady helps with arranging anything you want for at least 100 baht cheaper than most other hotels. We only paid about 600 baht per night (great deal for Aircon in a safe, clean room) Cons: mosquitoes in the dining/lobby area, some of her workers waiting can seem a little unfriendly, poor wi-fi signal, very basic room amenities, only one outlet in the room. Overall, this a budget hotel so don't expect luxury. But, it is clean and the rooms are nice. Ms. Yaa can get you the best tours available at arguably the best prices around. You might find a better deal on tours elsewhere but you would waste a lot of time and spend that time uncomfortably haggling everyone. Show more Jacob , United States Green Leaf Guesthouse 7.8 Very good Based on 29 reviews Coco Nori at Sea Hotel 5.9 Review score Based on 54 reviews its a very nice website for this hotel, but the reality is very different.situated right on the main road, with heavy quarry lorries going past day and night. we chose it as it promised free bicycles and free shuttle into aonang. the bikes were useless- only 2 small ones, one with a loose seat and one with only one pedal. whenever we asked for the free shuttle we had to argue as we were asked to pay.the rooms were not very well cleaned, and the stairways were always dirty-even though the hotel was almost empty while we were there, so the young staff had little to do.(they were quite pleasant, they were in the foyer most of the time watching tv or on the internet).the western breakfast advertised was very poor and inconsistent, with rarely any fruit juices or cereals,and none of the customary extra drinks etc.this is the first time we booked a hotel with no reviews - big mistake. Show more maureen , United Kingdom Baan Sabaidee Krabi Hotel 7.7 Very good Based on 591 reviews arriving from Koh Lanta using the minivan, my driver couldnt locate the hotel as it is at the corner of Maharaj soi 5 at the back. it is a shoplot type of hotel. lobby looks nice and colour decorated. welcome by the thai chinese lady owner. was given 2 keys. 1 room key and another 1 for side door key. according to the owner, the hotel lobby main entrance will be closed around 8.30.pm onwards, so if you come back late, you will need to open the side door to get into your room. We were given a room at 4th floor. No lift. Need to exercise caryying our own luggage all the way up. Room is simple with TV, A/C, & hot shower. Room has no window. Bed is abit hard. Recommended if only stay overnight before departing Krabi as airport is only 12km away. Walk to the nearest night market and Vogue shopping mall at night. Nothing much to see around. Mostly locals selling food and clothes. Had dinner at a small stalls by the road at the same row of hotel but at the other end. Food was good and cheap. Was manage to get a taxi arrangement by the hotel to airport with only 400bath for 2 pax. Overall, it's a pleasant stay if you dont ask much. wifi is provided. Show more WAN , Malaysia Sea Star House 7.9 Very good Based on 110 reviews We had a great time in Krabi. However, it would have been even better had the hotel staff performed better. Our group booked multiple rooms for TWO weeks. When we came in and out of the hotel, there were no good mornings, goodbyes, have a nice day, did you have a nice trip, etc. The staff often walked by us like we were invisible. This is not what I expected from a small hotel. Our rooms were clean enough but only on the surface. Upon a closer look, there was a lot of dust, cobwebs, and even stains that could have been easily wiped away by a wet cloth, which I did. The cleaning staff accidentally broke my jewelry and tried to hide it under some flyers! Upon confronting the management, a half-hearted offer was made to send it to repairs. Like I was really going to leave it in Ao Nang during my vacation for repairs!! No other effort was made to compensate for the damage, which was assessed at 50 USD when I got back home. Breakfast began at 7:45. However, when you are in Krabi, you will find out that many tour companies pick up their guests between 8 and 8:30. The breakfast service was so awfully slow that a few times, we had to wait at least 1/2 hour for our food and could only take a couple of bites before we were picked up. The hotel's location is great if you are not a light sleeper. You can reach the boats, restaurants, and shopping quite easily from here but the noise persists through the night. Although at the front desk, the hotel claimed to offer airport transfer, they were too lazy to arrange one for us, saying we should do it ourselves. When we checked out of the hotel, and after having spent over 2500 USD there, they did not even say thank you or goodbye to us. Nothing. We are very frequent travellers staying often at both big hotel chains and small family inns. We had never experienced this level of unfriendliness. I don't think the staff meant to be rude. I think they just lack the proper training. Show more Harmony , Canada The 9th House Krabi 9.7 Exceptional Based on 10 reviews Orange Tree House Hotel 7.9 Very good Based on 618 reviews this hotel is definitely the biggest let down so far in all online bookings i have done till date. bare basic hotel with following features advertised . (my comments in brackets) 1)airy room with window ( window opens up to face a brick wall. what was window for could not figure out) 2) free wifi (true but only in the lobby) 3) breakfast provided ( yes bread butter and coffee) other observations: bare basic room with lack of storage space. no chance of safe facility even at reception two single beds put together to make a double bed but clean beds total 12-14 rooms out of which renovation was on in 4-5 rooms. room had barely any light and thanks to windowless window no chance of getting sunlight paid hotel for arranging a shared minivan drop to phuket. they took us to the bus stand and put some touts there to arrange a transfer. they tried to stuff us into a mini van packed to hilt. finally after picking up a fight and paying additional got a bus out of krabi to phuket. paid 280 bhat per person overall whereas going to bust stop and boarding would have cost 140 bhat per person in bus. lots of good hotels in krabi and this hotel/motel can definitely be given a miss. Show more Livy , India Andaman Legacy Guest House 7.2 Very good Based on 446 reviews When I first booked this hotel, my travelling buddy and I wanted a place close to bars and pubs so we can grab a drink and watch some football. This hotel's location was close to perfect. When we checked in, we were offered the top floor. The WiFi was very good, and the beds were very comfortable! Most importantly, we had an issue with a booking we made with Lomprayah to go to Koh Samui. We were meant to get picked up at 8:30am, but we weren't. We asked the receptionist to assist us, and she did it without hesitation or reluctance. She called the company and got it sorted for us. The only negative was that the hot water didn't work properly when I tried to use it for the one time I was there. I don't mind cold showers all that much, but if you do then it's something to bear in mind. Had nice room with balcony..wiew not so much to talk aboat :) could see the streetlife, Cleanness and room size was good. Staff wery frendly. Breakfast was basic, what you coud exept for the price i paid, Could choose from set menu, no buffet. All in all i had a nice stay and feelt got value for money. But Ao Nang has got a lot more expencive than last time i was staying there. Hotel prices have doubled compared to standard. Koy and his wife made us feel very welcome, the room was wonderfully clean, with hot shower, air con, a little balcony and comfortable beds, ( with the best pillows yet experienced in Thailand!) The hotel is in a brilliant location, situated in a quiet side street with well kept Thai houses, but at the top of the road are lovely places to eat. It's a five minute walk to town, the pier for boats to Phra Nang, and the night market with delicious cheap food. Little local bars with live music just around the corner. At the moment the Baansamran does not offer food, but a little basic breakfast is available for 40 baht if required. Koy made every effort to facilitate trips and our onward journey at a much better price than all of the 'travel agents', and without any pressure to accept his help. I can't recommend this place highly enough. Show more Amanda , United Kingdom Blanco Room & Apartments 8.1 Excellent Based on 75 reviews I remember Ao Nang from a 5 day visit, 6 years ago. It was busy then. But it has grown wildly and is growing faster still. Blanco is 2.5 kms from the beach, but the road, outside is very busy with tuk tuks and taxis and motor bikes. My room, on the first floor landing, was large, comfortable and clean. There was no window, except a high skylight, which made it claustrophobic. If I opened the front door, I could see the rock cliffs, nearby. I ate in the restaurant on 2 occasions. A superb lasagne and a very good panini. I was tempted into getting a very good, if expensive, bottle of Aussie red and a portion of brownie and mixed ice cream. Both staff and owners are very friendly and efficient. Recommended for groups and families, who don't want to be in the middle of a tourist jungle. Show more Yu ,Singapore Discover the neighborhoods of Krabi Ao Nang 610 hotels Krabi Town 257 hotels Nopparat Thara 172 hotels Klong Muang 98 hotels Ao Num Mao Bay 56 hotels Tub Kaek Beach 48 hotels Railay 40 hotels Ban Sai Thai 25 hotels Had Yao 21 hotels Ban Tha Len 20 hotels Krabi Noi 18 hotels Klong Thom 13 hotels Ao Luek 10 hotels Ban Nai Chong 10 hotels Ton Sai 9 hotels Nuea Klong 7 hotels Koh Klang 7 hotels Ban Nai Sa 7 hotels Huai Nam Khao 4 hotels Ban Phela 2 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Resorts in Krabi 223 Guest Houses in Krabi 160 Apartments in Krabi 113 Hostels in Krabi 69 Serviced Apartments in Krabi 47 Bungalows in Krabi 27 More about Krabi Located in the south of Thailand, Krabi is famed for its limestone formations, calm crystal seas, and beautiful beaches. Krabi Town is one of the most visited towns in the province, since it serves as a departure point for ferries to the islands in Phangna Bay such as Phi Phi and Koh Lanta. There are several notable beaches on the mainland close to Krabi Town including Ao Nang , Railay Beach and Had Yao . Krabi International Airport serves travelers from Bangkok, Kuala Lumpur, Darwin, and Singapore and is just 15 kilometers from Krabi Town. The main activities in Krabi Town and its outlying villages center on relaxing on the beach, making it a perfect destination for vacationers. Ao Nang is one of the more popular tourist areas in the region, and the main road through town is lined with hotels, restaurants, bars, and shops. Klong Muang and Tub Kaek beaches are bit further north of Ao Nang and tend to cater to a more up-market crowd. The resorts on Klong Muang and Tub Kaek beaches offer a relaxed atmosphere and truly breathtaking views as well as top-notch services and facilities.
